page.title: 17Shropshire Observed Outing
page.content: On Sunday July 14th 1985, the Shropshire Natural History and Archaeological Society arranged an excursion to Clive and Grinshill. This was attended by approximately 150 people who were led around the area in groups by local experts in Geology, Botany, Ornithology,Landscape and Mining and Quarrying. Each walk lasted approximately an hour and finished at Clive School where the groups changed to another leader and were thus able to enjoy learning about more than one subject. The day's events were organised by Mr. Jeremy Krause, the Head of the Geography Department at Adams School, Wem, as a celebration of 150 years of observing and collecting of this society in Shropshire and were designed to recreate the Victorian spirit of enquiry and interest in the environment.
